Question Body: Which of the following is true regarding the "volatile" keyword in C?
QuestionAnwser/ExpectedResult: >The "volatile keyword is used to declare a variable that can be modified by another thread.>The "volatile" keyword is used to declare a variable that can be modified by an ISR.>The ""volatile"" keyword is used to declare a variable that can be modified by hardware.>All of the above are true."

Question Body: Which of the following is true regarding the "static keyword in C?
QuestionAnwser/ExpectedResult: >The "static" keyword can be used to declare global variables that can be accessed only within the file they are declared in.>The "static" keyword can be used to declare local variables that retain their value between function calls.>The "static" keyword can be used to declare functions that can be accessed only within the file they are declared in.>All of the above are true.
